org.pojava.datetime

Class DateTimeConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pojava.datetime.DateTimeConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IDateTimeConfig

    public class DateTimeConfig
extends Object
implements IDateTimeConfig, Serializable
    Establish global defaults for shaping DateTime behavior. This version supports English, German, French and Spanish month names in the date parser, and can be customized by your applications to interpret other languages.
    Author:
    John Pile
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isDmyOrder

        public boolean isDmyOrder()
        Returns true if 01/02/1970 is interpreted as 1970-02-01, returns false if 01/02/1970 is interpreted as 1970-01-02.
        Specified by:
        isDmyOrder in interface IDateTimeConfig
        Returns:
        True if DD/MM/YYYY is recognized by parser over MM/DD/YYYY.

      • getTzMap

        public Map<String,String> getTzMap()
        Description copied from interface: IDateTimeConfig
        Map of timezones and their offsets. You can customize the default map to add your own timezones by referencing other timezones.
        Specified by:
        getTzMap in interface IDateTimeConfig
        Returns:
        a Map of time zones recognized by DateTime.

        public int getEpochDOW()
